article_node.title: H&M Launches Fist Store in Brazil With Local Manufacturing Ambitions
article_node.summary: Swedish fast‑fashion retailer H&M has opened its first physical store in Brazil and launched online operations, marking a long‑planned entry into the market. The São Paulo flagship focuses on women’s fashion, with a second store slated to offer a broader range of products. H&M aims to compete with local brands by offering inclusive pricing while expanding local production of shoes, beachwear and jeans, and plans to open four stores in São Paulo state and eventually other states. The company also operates a 25,000‑square‑meter distribution center in Minas Gerais that could grow to 40,000 square meters.
